Grouped_Utterances: I think I’ve been handling my frustration better. I didn’t yell at my neighbor this time! I approached them calmly and said I was feeling overwhelmed by the noise. They actually apologized! I felt relieved. It was nice to communicate without fighting. I learned that talking things out can be better than avoiding them. It felt good to express myself. Well, I still have moments of sadness. It’s like a wave that comes and goes. That’s understandable, especially with your history of depression. Have you noticed any specific triggers for those waves of sadness? I try to distract myself with my dogs or watching a movie, but it doesn’t always work.
It was nice. I felt more relaxed, but I still woke up a few times.
Journaling can be as simple as writing down your thoughts and feelings as they come. You could start with prompts like, “Today I felt…” or “I miss my kids because…”
Of course! I’m here for you. Let’s check in on your journaling and any other developments next time. Take care until then!
